result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Hernandez, Serena R

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Seal Victim's Request to be Heard, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/21/2022
Motion and Order to Seal Victim's Request to be Heard
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  The Court will allow communication with Victim A through Our Family Wizard as it relates to the unborn child.  Court will reserve the right to bring a motion forward if Victim A indicates they would like to have contact.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

1:39 PM Defendant Serena R Hernandez in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Serena R Hernandez.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Attorney Carson challenges Count 2 of the Criminal Complaint and presents arguments.  Court denies the motion to to dismiss Count 2.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Court will reserve the right to bring a motion forward if Victim A indicates they would like to have contact.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
